arm_group.description: DEXA scan cardio-pulmonary exercise testing (CPEX) muscle biopsy

biospec_descr.textblock: blood tests for serum albumin and total protien levels.

brief_summary.textblock:
Curative treatment for oesophageal cancer involves undertaking chemotherapy followed by an
      operation to remove the tumour. Chemotherapy has several effects upon the body, including
      effects upon the systems that control the creation and breakdown of muscle. We aim to review
      these effects by recording changes in the amount of exercise patients are able to undertake
      after chemotherapy and reviewing changes in muscle mass.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Chemotherapy on Muscle Mass and Exercise Performance in Patients With Oesophageal Cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
We aim to review the effects of chemotherapy on skeletal muscle mass and cardio-respiratory
      performance in patients with oesophageal adenocarcinoma. All patients will be assessed by a
      Consultant Anaesthetist and a medical member of the Research team before commencing
      chemotherapy and after finishing their course. These assessments include a nutritional
      assessment, performance status assessments, blood assays, dual energy X-ray absorptiometry
      (DEXA) scans, cardio-pulmonary exercise (CPEX) testing and a muscle biopsy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  oesophageal cancer

          -  Multidisciplinary team decision to offer neoadjuvant chemotherapy prior to surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Metastatic disease

intervention.description: all patients will undertake a full body DEXA scan before and after chemotherapy
All patients will have a muscle biopsy before and after chemotherapy
patients will undertake exercise in the form of an exercise bike whilst having their cardiac and ventilatory performance analysed. This will take place before and after neoadjuvant chemotherapy

facility.name: Graduate Entry Medical School, University of Nottingham

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy on Muscle Mass and Peri-operative Cardiorespiratory Performance in Patients Undergoing Oesophageal Cancer- a Pilot Study

overall_official.affiliation: Graduate Entry Medical School, University of Nottingham

primary_outcome.description: variations in muscle mass during neoadjuvant chemotherapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: assess nutritional status post chemotherapy via serum protein levels.
Evidence of mortality and relate this to aerobic ability.
review changes in mitochondrial function after neoadjuvant chemotherapy
review changes in cardiorespiratory performance (peak VO2) after neoadjuvant chemotherapy

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
